decks.notes: The deck focuses on an aggressive Boros strategy, utilizing cards like Legion's Landing, History of Benalia, and Venerated Loxodon to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent. With efficient low-cost creatures like Skymarcher Aspirant and Adanto Vanguard, combined with powerful anthems like Benalish Marshal, the deck aims to close out games quickly before the opponent can stabilize. Conclave Tribunal and Pride of Conquerors offer additional removal and pump effects to push through damage and secure victory.

The Boros Aggro deck focuses on maximizing early game aggression and creating a wide board presence through low-cost creatures like Dauntless Bodyguard, Benalish Marshal, Adanto Vanguard, and Healer's Hawk. These creatures are supported by cards like Ajani's Pridemate and Pride of Conquerors to further boost their power. The deck also includes disruption elements like Conclave Tribunal to deal with opposing threats. History of Benalia helps generate tokens for added pressure and late game value. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistent casting of spells.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively flood the board with low-cost creatures like Skymarcher Aspirant, Hunted Witness, and Adanto Vanguard, supported by cards like Heroic Reinforcements and Legion's Landing to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Boros Challenger, Aurelia, Exemplar of Justice, and Pride of Conquerors also enhances the deck's aggressive capabilities. The deck also includes removal options like Conclave Tribunal to deal with opposing threats. By efficiently utilizing its strong creature base and combat tricks, this deck aims to close out games swiftly.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly developing a wide board presence with low-cost efficient creatures like Rustwing Falcon, Skymarcher Aspirant, and Benalish Marshal. The deck aims to push damage quickly with cards like Heroic Reinforcements and History of Benalia, while also utilizing cards like Legion's Landing and Adanto Vanguard for resilience. The inclusion of Conclave Tribunal provides removal options, while Venerated Loxodon offers a powerful buff to the team. With a focus on aggressive early game plays and pumping out damage, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on aggressive, fast-paced playstyle with a mix of white creatures and red burn spells. Cards like History of Benalia and Heroic Reinforcements pump up the board quickly, while key creatures like Aurelia, Exemplar of Justice provide additional power. Conclave Tribunal helps to clear the way for attacks by removing threats, and Legion's Landing helps to generate additional creatures. The mana base is focused on white sources to support the aggressive white creatures, with a splash of red for burn spells. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures and quick damage output.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying cheap and efficient creatures like Goblin Electromancer, Enigma Drake, and Arclight Phoenix while supporting them with spells like Shock and Lava Coil for removal and disruption. Drawing cards and digging through the deck is also crucial with cards like Chart a Course, Radical Idea, and Discovery / Dispersal. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and powerful creatures while maintaining a constant stream of card advantage and tempo.

The main concept of this Jeskai Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. The deck aims to maintain board control and card advantage while gradually increasing its own resources. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria serves as a powerful card advantage engine and win condition, while Crackling Drake provides additional threats. The deck includes a mix of counter spells, removal spells, and card draw to keep the opponent on the back foot and ultimately outvalue them in the late game.

The focus of this deck is to flood the board with small, efficient creatures and overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. By playing low-cost creatures like Dauntless Bodyguard, Skymarcher Aspirant, and Adanto Vanguard, followed by powerful anthem effects like Benalish Marshal and Venerated Loxodon, this deck aims to quickly build a wide board presence and bring the opponent's life total to zero before they have a chance to stabilize. Cards like History of Benalia and Legion's Landing provide additional value and resilience to the deck's strategy.

This deck focuses on aggressive play by quickly dealing damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to build a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and spellcasting. The deck utilizes cards like Shock and Lava Coil to deal damage to both creatures and the opponent. It also includes card draw spells like Radical Idea and Opt to maintain card advantage and find the necessary resources. The inclusion of Arclight Phoenix and Crackling Drake allows for explosive turns and additional damage. The deck also incorporates some control aspects with cards like Blink of an Eye and Beacon Bolt.

Mono Blue Aggro focuses on playing creatures with low casting costs and efficiently controlling the board with counter spells and protection spells. The deck aims to quickly establish a board presence and maintain pressure on the opponent while protecting its own creatures. Curious Obsession provides card advantage and can help draw into more threats. Tempest Djinn is a powerful finisher that benefits from the deck's high Island count. The deck also includes disruptive creatures like Merfolk Trickster and Warkite Marauder to disrupt the opponent's game plan and push through damage.

This deck focuses on flooding the board with small, aggressive creatures and boosting them with powerful pump spells such as Heroic Reinforcements. The strategy is to overwhelm opponents with a quick, powerful attack while also using cards like Venerated Loxodon and Benalish Marshal to provide additional buffs to the team. With a mix of low-cost creatures and strong anthem effects, the deck aims to take control of the battlefield early and maintain pressure throughout the game. The key to success lies in curving out efficiently and maximizing the synergies between cards.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly play low cost spells and creatures, utilizing cards like Goblin Electromancer to reduce mana costs. By quickly filling up the graveyard with spells, the player can bring back powerful threats like Arclight Phoenix. The deck also includes removal spells like Lava Coil and Beacon Bolt to deal with enemy threats. Overall, the strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and efficient card draw to maintain momentum and pressure.

The main idea of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of powerful creatures and aggressive tactics. By combining strong early-game creatures like Adanto Vanguard and Skymarcher Aspirant with powerful pumps like Benalish Marshal and History of Benalia, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence and deal damage quickly. Cards like Heroic Reinforcements provide a burst of damage, while Conclave Tribunal helps to control the opponent's threats. With efficient mana base and a focus on aggression, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent can fully set up their game plan.

This aggressive Golgari deck focuses on early ramp with Llanowar Elves and Druid of the Cowl, followed by powerful mid-range threats like Jadelight Ranger and Carnage Tyrant. The deck utilizes cards like Vraska, Golgari Queen and Ravenous Chupacabra for removal, while also incorporating card advantage with Karn, Scion of Urza and Vivien Reid. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of efficient creatures, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers to secure victory in the mid to late game.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays with a combination of efficient creatures such as Llanowar Elves and Jadelight Ranger, supported by removal spells like Ravenous Chupacabra and Vraska's Contempt. The key concept is to quickly establish board presence and maintain pressure on the opponent through the mid to late game with powerful threats like Carnage Tyrant and Doom Whisperer. The deck also has card advantage and graveyard recursion with Find/Finality and Vivien Reid to outvalue the opponent. The mana base is optimized to consistently cast the spells and creatures in the deck.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence with efficient creatures like Merfolk Branchwalker and Wildgrowth Walker, supported by ramp cards like Llanowar Elves. The deck also includes removal spells like Vraska's Contempt and Cast Down to deal with threats from the opponent. With cards like Vivien Reid and Doom Whisperer providing additional card advantage and pressure, the Golgari Aggro deck aims to control the board and apply pressure to the opponent, ultimately securing victory through aggressive, creature-based strategies.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive play, utilizing powerful creatures like Jadelight Ranger and Carnage Tyrant to overwhelm opponents. The deck also includes removal spells like Vraska's Contempt and Ravenous Chupacabra to control the board. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Vraska, Golgari Queen and Vivien Reid provide additional value and card advantage. The key strategy is to quickly establish a strong board presence, disrupt the opponent's strategy with removal spells, and close out the game with powerful finishers like Carnage Tyrant.

The main concept of this deck is to use cheap spells and card draw to quickly fill the graveyard with spells in order to bring back Arclight Phoenix and pump up Crackling Drake. The deck aims to apply early pressure with Goblin Electromancer and Shock while also having ways to control the board with Lava Coil and Beacon Bolt. The use of spells like Opt, Radical Idea, and Chart a Course allows for consistent card advantage and potentially multiple Phoenix activations per turn. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and card advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with instant and sorcery cards in order to bring back powerful creatures like Arclight Phoenix and maintain cheap spells with the help of Goblin Electromancer. By utilizing card draw and damage spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and direct damage, ultimately creating a fast-paced and efficient aggressive strategy.

The primary focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells and counterspells, while also utilizing powerful card draw engines to maintain card advantage. By using Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, Niv-Mizzet, Parun, and Crackling Drake as win conditions, the deck aims to control the board and ensure the opponent is unable to execute their game plan effectively. The inclusion of cards like Deafening Clarion and Lava Coil provides additional removal options, while Search for Azcanta helps with card selection and filtering. Ultimately, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through careful resource management.

The main concept of this Jeskai Control deck is to control the game by countering and removing opponent's threats while maintaining card advantage with cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Chemister's Insight. The deck focuses on using counterspells and removal spells to control the board, while also having powerful finishers like Niv-Mizzet, Parun and Crackling Drake to close out the game. The mana base consists of dual lands to ensure the deck can cast its spells consistently and efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is on controlling the game by using a combination of powerful spells and creatures. This Jeskai Control deck utilizes card advantage, counterspells, and removal to outvalue and outlast opponents. With cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, Crackling Drake, and Niv-Mizzet, Parun, the deck aims to control the board while drawing cards and dealing damage efficiently. By maintaining a strong control over the game through card advantage and removal, this deck looks to slowly grind out victories against opponents in a Standard 1 vs 1 format.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive red creatures and burn spells. By playing low mana cost creatures like Fanatical Firebrand and Ghitu Lavarunner, as well as powerful cards like Goblin Chainwhirler and Rekindling Phoenix, the deck aims to deal damage rapidly and efficiently. Spells like Lightning Strike and Shock provide direct damage, while Experimental Frenzy allows continuous card advantage and the ability to keep the pressure on the opponent. The goal is to close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main idea of this Aggro Red Deck Wins deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with fast and efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Experimental Frenzy to generate card advantage and cards like Rekindling Phoenix for resilience, you aim to deal damage as quickly as possible to push your opponent into a corner. With a low mana curve and high amount of burn and creature damage, the deck aims to close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with fast and efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures. By combining a low mana curve with powerful cards like Experimental Frenzy, Rekindling Phoenix, and Goblin Chainwhirler, this deck aims to deal steady damage and control the board. The goal is to end the game as quickly as possible before the opponent has a chance to stabilize and mount a defense. The strategy is to be relentless and keep the pressure on constantly, forcing the opponent to react defensively.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with low-cost, aggressive creatures and burn spells. By consistently dealing damage early in the game and maintaining pressure throughout, the deck aims to secure a victory before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Rekindling Phoenix and Experimental Frenzy provide additional threats and card advantage to help maintain momentum. The focus is on proactive plays and efficient removal to keep the opponent on the back foot and ultimately secure a swift victory.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a wide board presence of creatures with strong synergy, utilizing cards that create tokens and pump up those tokens or other creatures. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures, while also having some powerful finishers like Ajani, Adversary of Tyrants and Trostani Discordant. The key strategy is to keep the pressure on the opponent through consistent token generation and efficient use of buffs and removal spells to maintain board dominance.

The deck focuses on quickly developing a wide board presence with low-cost creatures like Adanto Vanguard and Emmara, Soul of the Accord, which can be buffed with Venerated Loxodon and March of the Multitudes. The use of Ajani, Adversary of Tyrants and Trostani Discordant adds resilience and additional creature generation. Additionally, the deck includes removal with Conclave Tribunal and card draw with Flower / Flourish. The game plan revolves around overwhelming the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and powerful buffs to secure victory in the early to mid-game.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence with efficient creatures like Wildgrowth Walker, Carnage Tyrant, and Jadelight Ranger, while using removal spells like Cast Down and Vraska's Contempt to control the opponent's board. The deck utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Vraska, Golgari Queen and Vivien Reid to generate card advantage and provide additional threats. Additionally, the deck has good synergy with cards like Midnight Reaper and Ravenous Chupacabra to ensure card advantage and flexibility in dealing with various threats.

This deck is built around quickly establishing a board presence with aggressive creatures like Adanto Vanguard, Rekindling Phoenix, and Lyra Dawnbringer, while also utilizing powerful control cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Ixalan's Binding to disrupt the opponent's strategies. The inclusion of cards like History of Benalia and Resplendent Angel provide additional value and pressure on the opponent. By combining aggressive creatures with disruptive spells, this Jeskai Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on early aggression with low-cost creatures like Snubhorn Sentry, Skymarcher Aspirant, and Adanto Vanguard. Benalish Marshal boosts the power of your creatures, while Heroic Reinforcements and History of Benalia provide additional ways to pump up your board. Conclave Tribunal helps to remove any threats your opponent may have, allowing you to continue pressing your advantage. With a mix of creatures and powerful spells, this deck aims to overwhelm your opponent quickly and efficiently.

This deck focuses on aggressive, fast-paced gameplay with a combination of strong, low-cost creatures like Dauntless Bodyguard, Adanto Vanguard, and Healer's Hawk. The goal is to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with creatures, using cards like Benalish Marshal and Ajani's Pridemate to boost their power. The deck also includes support cards like Conclave Tribunal and Pride of Conquerors to control the board and give the creatures additional buffs. Overall, the key strategy is to apply early pressure and maintain tempo throughout the game.

The deck focuses on quickly building a strong board presence with low-cost creatures and powerful enchantments like History of Benalia. It utilizes cards like Legion's Landing and Heroic Reinforcements to go wide and overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Benalish Marshal and Ajani, Adversary of Tyrants helps to boost the power of the creatures on the battlefield. The deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent early on and maintain that pressure throughout the game to secure a win through aggressive play.

The main idea of this Boros Aggro deck is to establish a fast and aggressive board presence through a combination of low-cost creatures and anthem effects. By deploying efficient threats like Adanto Vanguard and Benalish Marshal early on, supported by cards like Heroic Reinforcements and History of Benalia, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize. Additionally, the inclusion of removal options like Conclave Tribunal provides some flexibility in handling opposing threats, ensuring that the pressure remains on the opponent throughout the game.

The deck focuses on building a strong board presence quickly with low-cost creatures such as Adanto Vanguard, Skymarcher Aspirant, and Dauntless Bodyguard. Benalish Marshal and Heroic Reinforcements help buff up the creatures to finish off the opponent quickly. History of Benalia and Legion's Landing provide additional value with tokens and mana ramp. Ixalan's Binding helps control the opponent's threats. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient combat tricks while maintaining a strong board presence.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly swarm the board with low-cost aggressive creatures and pump them up with anthem effects like Benalish Marshal and Heroic Reinforcements. The deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent, utilizing cards like Adanto Vanguard and Dauntless Bodyguard to protect key creatures. History of Benalia provides a strong tempo advantage, while cards like Conclave Tribunal help to maintain board control. The inclusion of Aurelia, Exemplar of Justice adds a powerful top-end threat to close out games.

The main idea of this Boros Aggro deck is to flood the board with aggressive creatures like Adanto Vanguard, Knight of Grace, and Skymarcher Aspirant, backed up by powerful anthem effects from cards like Benalish Marshal and Heroic Reinforcements. History of Benalia provides additional token generation and Conclave Tribunal serves as removal. The deck aims to apply early pressure and go wide with creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure victory. Aurelia, Exemplar of Justice provides a powerful late-game threat to seal the deal.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. By playing creatures like Adanto Vanguard, Benalish Marshal, and Skymarcher Aspirant early on, the deck can quickly build a strong board presence. Cards like Venerated Loxodon and Pride of Conquerors can further pump up the team for a devastating attack. Additionally, Conclave Tribunal and History of Benalia provide removal and additional threats. The deck aims to close out games quickly and efficiently by using the Boros colors to their full advantage.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and creating a wide board presence early in the game. By playing efficient creatures like Dauntless Bodyguard and Skymarcher Aspirant, backed up by powerful anthem effects like Benalish Marshal and Heroic Reinforcements, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly. History of Benalia and Legion's Landing provide additional value and token generation to further push the aggression. Conclave Tribunal offers removal options to clear the way for attacks, while the mana base ensures consistent access to the cards needed to maintain pressure on the opponent.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and powerful removal spells to quickly overwhelm opponents. Adanto Vanguard, Aurelia, Exemplar of Justice, Lyra Dawnbringer, Rekindling Phoenix, and Resplendent Angel provide strong attacking options, while Tocatli Honor Guard disrupts opponents' strategies. Lava Coil, Deafening Clarion, Shock, and Ixalan's Binding are used for removal and controlling the board. History of Benalia provides additional creatures and buffs, while the mana base ensures consistent casting of spells. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control of the battlefield throughout the game.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly establishing a strong board presence and putting pressure on the opponent. By utilizing powerful creatures like Adanto Vanguard, Rekindling Phoenix, and Lyra Dawnbringer, along with disruptive cards like Tocatli Honor Guard and Remorseful Cleric, the deck aims to control the game early on. Cards like History of Benalia and Resplendent Angel provide additional support and value. The deck also includes removal spells like Lava Coil and Lightning Strike to deal with threats, while Ixalan's Binding helps to keep the opponent's key cards in check.

The main idea behind this Esper Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan by using counter spells, removal, and planeswalker abilities. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's tempo, generate card advantage, and eventually win the game with powerful finishers like Chromium, the Mutable. By maintaining a strong board presence and controlling the flow of the game, this deck can outvalue the opponent and secure victory through sheer control and strategy.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to aggressively establish board presence and pressure the opponent with efficient creatures like Jadelight Ranger, Wildgrowth Walker, and Carnage Tyrant. The deck also utilizes removal spells like Cast Down and Vraska's Contempt to control the board and maintain tempo. The inclusion of card advantage engines like Midnight Reaper and Vivien Reid helps to ensure a steady stream of threats while Find / Finality provides options for recursion or board wipes. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of threats and disruption to secure victory.

The key concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to maintain a strong board presence early on with creatures like Llanowar Elves and Wildgrowth Walker, while also utilizing cards like Jadelight Ranger and Ravenous Chupacabra to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, the deck aims to generate value and card advantage with cards like Vivien Reid and Golgari Findbroker, while also having access to removal options in Vraska's Contempt and Assassin's Trophy. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Carnage Tyrant and Vraska, Relic Seeker to close out games.

The main focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is to apply constant pressure on the opponent by playing efficient creatures like Jadelight Ranger and Carnage Tyrant, while also disrupting their game plan with removal spells like Vraska's Contempt and Assassin's Trophy. The deck also includes cards like Wildgrowth Walker and Midnight Reaper to maintain card advantage and gain life. Additionally, the deck utilizes the graveyard with Golgari Findbroker and Memorial to Folly to recur threats and maintain board presence. Overall, the key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggression and resilience.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays while also incorporating cards that provide card advantage and mana ramp. The deck includes powerful creatures like Carnage Tyrant and Jadelight Ranger alongside removal spells like Cast Down and Vraska's Contempt. Vivien Reid and Vraska, Golgari Queen provide additional value and flexibility, while the overall synergy between creatures and spells allows for a consistent and versatile gameplay strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing creatures with explore abilities to quickly ramp up mana and card advantage. It aims to control the board with removal spells like Ravenous Chupacabra while also applying pressure with big threats like Carnage Tyrant and Vivien Reid. The Golgari Findbroker allows for recursion of key cards from the graveyard while cards like Wildgrowth Walker provide life gain to help stabilize against aggressive decks. The deck also has powerful planeswalkers like Vraska, Golgari Queen and Vivien Reid to provide additional value and card advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence with cards like Llanowar Elves and Wildgrowth Walker, while utilizing cards like Jadelight Ranger and Vivien Reid to generate card advantage and maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes removal spells like Ravenous Chupacabra and Vraska's Contempt to deal with opposing threats, along with powerful finishers like Carnage Tyrant and Karn, Scion of Urza. Golgari Findbroker and Memorial to Folly provide recursion to keep the pressure on the opponent, making it a well-rounded Aggro deck with a Golgari twist.

The main focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is to establish a strong early game board presence with creatures like Jadelight Ranger, Merfolk Branchwalker, and Wildgrowth Walker, while also using cards like Midnight Reaper and Vivien Reid for card advantage and removal. The deck also includes powerful late game threats like Carnage Tyrant and Vraska, Golgari Queen to close out the game. The deck utilizes a mix of creatures, removal spells, and planeswalkers to maintain pressure on the opponent and adapt to different game situations.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence with early mana acceleration from Llanowar Elves, and then follow up with strong midrange threats like Wildgrowth Walker, Jadelight Ranger, and Carnage Tyrant. The deck also utilizes graveyard recursion with Golgari Findbroker and Memorial to Folly, as well as removal spells like Vraska's Contempt and Cast Down to control the board. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a steady stream of threats while disrupting their game plan with removal and resilience.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on fast ramping with Llanowar Elves and aggressive creatures like Wildgrowth Walker and Jadelight Ranger to overwhelm opponents early on. It also includes removal options like Ravenous Chupacabra and Vraska's Contempt to deal with threats. The deck's mid-game strategy revolves around maximizing value with Golgari Findbroker and Carnage Tyrant while maintaining board presence. Find / Finality provides versatility in both retrieving key cards and clearing the board if needed. The deck aims to pressure opponents with a mix of efficient creatures and removal spells for a consistent and potent aggro strategy.

The deck focuses on using hand disruption and removal spells to control the game while developing its own threats like Doom Whisperer and Nicol Bolas, the Ravager. It also includes card draw and counter spells to maintain card advantage and protect its game plan. The inclusion of cards like Thought Erasure and Disinformation Campaign helps to disrupt the opponent's strategy and slow down their game plan. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through a combination of control elements and powerful threats.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly build a board presence with efficient and aggressive creatures like Arclight Phoenix and Enigma Drake while utilizing spells like Chart a Course and Crash Through to draw cards and deal damage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of direct damage, card advantage, and evasion abilities. It also includes protection spells like Dive Down to keep its key threats safe. The deck thrives on managing resources effectively and applying maximum pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly casting cheap spells to enable the Arclight Phoenix and pump up the Enigma Drake and Crackling Drake. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of aggressive creatures and burn spells, taking advantage of the card draw from Chart a Course and Tormenting Voice to maintain momentum. The deck aims to control the board with burn spells like Lava Coil and Shock while leveraging the flying and spell-based damage from its creatures to close out the game efficiently.

This deck focuses on quickly dropping low-cost spells to fill the graveyard and bring back Arclight Phoenix for continuous pressure, while also leveraging powerful card draw and removal spells to control the board and maintain tempo. The deck aims to aggressively attack the opponent's life total with efficient creatures and burn spells, utilizing the synergy between cheap spells and spell-based creatures to overwhelm the opponent and close out games quickly.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures like Arclight Phoenix, Enigma Drake, and Crackling Drake, while leveraging instants and sorceries to trigger the Phoenix's ability and pump up the Drakes. The deck also includes cards like Tormenting Voice and Chart a Course for card advantage, as well as spells like Maximize Velocity and Crash Through for additional damage output. The mana base is solid with a mix of lands to ensure consistent casting of spells and creatures.

This deck focuses on utilizing spells and cheap creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By casting spells like Opt, Shock, and Chart a Course to draw cards and deal damage, the player can power up creatures like Enigma Drake and Arclight Phoenix to finish the game strong. The use of Goblin Electromancer helps reduce the cost of spells, while Crackling Drake benefits from the player's spell-heavy strategy. By maximizing the effectiveness of low-cost spells and strong creatures, this deck aims to win the game swiftly before the opponent can set up their own strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures like Arclight Phoenix, Crackling Drake, and Enigma Drake, while using cards like Goblin Electromancer and Tormenting Voice to facilitate the casting of spells. The deck utilizes a variety of card draw, removal, and counter magic to maintain board presence and apply pressure on the opponent. By efficiently utilizing instants and sorceries, the deck aims to deal significant damage to opponents and close out games quickly. Balancing aggression with card advantage and disruption is key to the deck's success.

This deck focuses on quickly playing powerful creatures like Arclight Phoenix, Crackling Drake, and Enigma Drake while maximizing card draw and spell efficiency with cards like Tormenting Voice, Chart a Course, and Radial Idea. Using Goblin Electromancer to reduce casting costs and spells like Opt and Shock to control the board, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a flurry of cheap spells and strong creatures. With a mix of burn, card draw, and explosive creature plays, this UR Aggro deck is designed to apply pressure early and maintain tempo throughout the game.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on utilizing removal spells such as Lava Coil, Seal Away, and Cleansing Nova to control the board and handle threats from the opponent. The deck also includes a variety of counterspells like Syncopate and Ionize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The win condition of the deck is to stabilize the board with Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and control the game until you can close it out with cards like Expansion / Explosion or Rekindling Phoenix. Overall, the key strategy is to control the game until you can overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by ensuring board control through removal spells and counterspells while generating card advantage and value with cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Niv-Mizzet, Parun. The deck focuses on staying ahead on resources and denying the opponent's threats, eventually winning the game through incremental advantage and high impact spells like Settle the Wreckage and Expansion / Explosion. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the three color combination of white, blue, and red efficiently.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through counterspells, removal spells, and board wipes while generating card advantage and card selection with Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Search for Azcanta. The win condition is to slowly chip away at the opponent's life total with evasive threats like Crackling Drake and Niv-Mizzet, Parun. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent by maintaining control of the game and overwhelming them with powerful spells and creatures.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with low-cost, evasive creatures like Siren Stormtamer, Mist-Cloaked Herald, and Tempest Djinn. The deck includes a mix of tempo-control cards like Merfolk Trickster and Warkite Marauder to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of card draw with Chart a Course and Curious Obsession helps maintain card advantage, while protection spells like Dive Down and Spell Pierce help protect key creatures. The deck aims to maintain pressure and control the board through efficient use of its resources.

The deck focuses on playing aggressively with strong, low-cost creatures like Goblin Chainwhirler and Legion Warboss to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Rekindling Phoenix and Siege-Gang Commander provide additional threats that are difficult to remove. Removal spells like Lava Coil and Banefire help control the board and clear a path to victory. Treasure Map provides card advantage and helps ramp into more powerful threats. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence and deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. By utilizing low-cost aggressive creatures like Fanatical Firebrand and Viashino Pyromancer, along with burn spells like Shock and Lightning Strike, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of Experimental Frenzy allows for additional card advantage and bypasses potential mana restrictions, ensuring a constant stream of threats and damage.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly. By playing low-cost creatures like Fanatical Firebrand and Ghitu Lavarunner, along with powerful spells like Shock and Lightning Strike, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Runaway Steam-Kin and Experimental Frenzy help to maintain momentum and generate card advantage, while Rekindling Phoenix provides a strong threat that can be difficult to deal with. Overall, the deck is designed to win games quickly through aggressive plays and efficient removal.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and burn spells. By playing efficient creatures like Fanatical Firebrand and Goblin Chainwhirler, along with powerful burn spells like Lightning Strike and Shock, you can quickly reduce your opponent's life total. Cards like Experimental Frenzy allow you to keep up the pressure by letting you play additional cards from the top of your library. Overall, this deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently to win the game before your opponent can stabilize.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using cheap and efficient red creatures and burn spells. With a low mana curve and plenty of direct damage, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain it throughout the game. The inclusion of cards like Viashino Pyromancer and Goblin Chainwhirler helps control the board while cards like Rekindling Phoenix provide resilience. Experimental Frenzy allows the player to keep drawing cards and maintain their aggression without running out of resources.

This aggressive red deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with low-cost creatures like Fanatical Firebrand, Ghitu Lavarunner, and Goblin Chainwhirler. Runaway Steam-Kin helps ramp up mana while Rekindling Phoenix provides a powerful threat. Removal spells like Lava Coil and Fight with Fire help control the board, while burn spells like Shock and Lightning Strike target the opponent directly. Treasure Map provides card advantage and mana fixing, while Experimental Frenzy allows for explosive plays late in the game. The deck's strategy is to maintain pressure and finish off opponents swiftly.

The deck is focused on overwhelming the opponent with fast and efficient creatures and burn spells. By playing aggressively and quickly, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently, while utilizing cards like Experimental Frenzy to maintain card advantage and pressure the opponent. The deck is designed to keep the pressure on the opponent from the beginning of the game until victory is achieved. This Red Deck Wins archetype is all about quick, aggressive plays and efficient removal, aiming to win the game as fast as possible.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan by utilizing various control elements such as hand disruption, removal spells, and creatures that steal or exile cards from the opponent's deck. The goal is to maintain board control through a combination of efficient removal and card advantage, ultimately outvaluing the opponent and securing victory through card advantage and incremental advantage. The deck aims to establish dominance on the battlefield and dictate the pace of the game, gradually overwhelming the opponent with its powerful control elements.

This deck focuses on quickly building a wide board of small, aggressive creatures in the White Weenie archetype. By playing powerful early game threats like Skymarcher Aspirant and Adanto Vanguard, supported by pump effects from cards like Benalish Marshal and Venerated Loxodon, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient offense. With cards like History of Benalia providing additional value and support, this deck aims to consistently put pressure on the opponent and end the game before they have a chance to stabilize.
